repository.rDescription: The Ergani repository contains documented archival material that illustrates 200 years of history and culture in north eastern Aegean. However, the site expects to extend this to incorporate other items in the near future.

Each online paper is displayed with a readily accessible statistical snap-shot of its use online. An email update alert service is available for registered users.

This is an institutional based repository for the Washington Research Library Consortium, comprising 7 regional institutions. While it is the whole site can be searched as one, it is also possible to focus enquiries down to the individual institutions' publications only. It is possible for authors to make their documents available online to a restricted audience only. A nominated contact for each of the institutions is listed within the site's help and guidance information.

This site is a repository of information, publications and resources conglomerated from various sources on the Alaskan region of the United States of America. These are subdivided for browsing purposes into 10 separate sub-archives. The site is well supported with background and guidance materials. The site is especially rich in multimedia and image resources.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Maps, oral history files. This site is a collaboration between University of Alaska Fairbanks, Alaska State Library, Anchorage Museum of History and Art, Seward Community Library Association, University of Alaska Museum of the North, Sitka Tribal Library and University of Alaska, Anchorage

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Interface available in Chinese and Chinese (simplified) and English. A few items are not available as full-text.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The attractive site interface is fully available in German, Italian, French and English, including the background information and supporting documentation. It is possible to browse for materials produced within particular projects, as well as across the institution or by individual author. Three RSS feeds are available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials, projects or other news items.

repository.oName: Institute of Public Health in Ireland
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to health information. The majority of the content is metadata only, providing access to resources held externally. The interface is available in various languages.

repository.oName: Alma Mater Studiorum, Università di Bologna
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the lecture notes and presentations used at the institution in an educational context. The site interface is available in Italian only and includes RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
This site provides access to the output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.
This is the institutional repository of the Altai State University. The interface is in Russian and it has RSS feeds to inform users of new items.

This is an extensive repository containing material relating to the American experience, a large portion of it digitised from the Library of Congress' collections. It includes, but is not limited to, images, monographs, sheet music, sound and visual recordings, pamphlets and posters. It is subdivided into over 100 thematic collections based on original documentation format, subject, author or donor. The site also benefits from an extensive range of background documentation and information on the creation, maintenance and development of this repository. Individual sections of the collection are periodically highlighted, and materials advising on the use of this repository's contents in a classroom situation are also provided. Each major subsection has a discrete site design and interface, although they are all part of the overarching whole.
This site is a subject based repository containing structural information on crystals published in a number of key journals.

repository.rName: American Museum of Natural History Scientific Publications
repository.postalAddress: Central Park West at 79th St., New York, NY 10024
repository.rDescription: This site is a institutional repository providing access to the publication output of the museum's scientific endeavours. The site includes articles in current and past issues of the AMNH scientific series. As such the material available here covers over a century of research in the anthropological, and natural history domains.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Many items are not available as full-text. The interface is in English. Ansenuza is an open access, free-of-charge repository of educational materials, organized by the National University of Córdoba, and the Education Ministry of Córdoba province. The repository aims to provide teaching materials for all educational levels, with an emphasis in local needs. Work by university faculty and teaching professionals are both welcome. All the materials are included under a Creative Commons licence. All materials must allow derivative works, while only some allow commercial uses. The interface is in Spanish.

repository.oName: Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation

repository.uName: Center for Digital Discourse and Culture
repository.oName: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
repository.rDescription: This archive works actively to deploy electronic media for the collection, interpretation, preservation, and display of stories and digital objects related to the tragedy of April 16, 2007, Blacksburg, Virginia and its many effects as text, image, and sound. Developed in cooperation with George Mason University's Center for History and New Media (CHNM), this project is receiving technical, curatorial and administrative support from Virginia Tech students, faculty, and staff.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include media reports, external links, personal writings, offical statements, podcasts and blog postings

repository.rRemarks: This repository focuses on Aquatic sciences (marine, freshwater, estuarine/brackish) .

This contributes to an experience when accessing the site somewhat of an exercise in frustration. Site is no longer accepting submissions.

Architexturez South Asia aggregates ideas and propositions concerning physical space and the related disciplines in the subcontinent of India. It documents processes, critical texts and nomothetic cases representing conditions obtained in South Asia.
Documents are stored online for educational purpose, under fair use of the Berne Convention. The interface is in English and has an RSS feed to alert users to new content.

repository.postalAddress: St Pancras, 96 Euston Road, London, NW1 2DB
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to sound recordings. Some items are restricted to registered users. The interface is available in English.

repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository collecting and providing materials related to educational technologies and effective communication. The site interface is available in English or French, although a lot of the copious supporting material remains in the latter language only.

repository.postalAddress: Ecole Normale Supérieure 29, rue d'Ulm, Pavillon Jardin, F-75007 Paris
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. A RSS feed is available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: CCSD Special items include: Newspaper articles.

repository.rDescription: A subject based repository for research materials on European integration and unification with materials from members of 15 institutions in Europe and the United States. The associated search engine AEIPlus allows simultaneous searching of both the AEI, and the European Research Papers Archive (ERPA), including the European Integration online Papers (EIOP). The interface is in English and contains RSS feeds to alert users of new content.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: European Research Papers Archive;European Union Center, University Center for International Studies, University of Pittsburgh;European Union Studies Association

repository.rDescription: The UCLA Music Library's Archive of Popular American Music is a research collection covering the history of popular music in the United States from 1790 to the present. The collection is one of the largest in the country, numbering almost 450,000 pieces of sheet music, anthologies, and arrangements for band and orchestra. The collection also includes 62,500 recordings on disc, tape, and cylinder.
repository.rRemarks: Speical Items: Sheet Music

repository.rName: Archive of the Institute of Business Economics (Vállalatgazdaságtan Intézet Archivuma)

repository.rName: Archive ouverte de l'Université de la Nouvelle-Calédonie
repository.rDescription: This repository contains: Scientific publications, student works, courses and conferences and podcasts from University of New Caledonia. The interface is in French.

repository.rDescription: This is a subject based repository providing access to the output of the Centre for Communication of Science and its almost 40 constituent organisations. The materials within this repository therefore reflect the interest of this organisation being concerned with all aspects of information and communication of scientific information. The site is available principally in French, with a English version of some of the major options. Documents are routinely offered in up to three different viewing formats including Word, PDF & HTML. A RSS feed is available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials.

This site is an institutional repository providing access to the online publication archive, and digitised documents, held by the German National Library. Those items held on this server are primarily digitised historical documents, other items are accessible via external sites only. The site interface is available in German and English.

This is the Institutional repository of University of Turin, Italy. The site interface is in Italian.

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository which provides open access to the publications produced by the members of our University, mainly theses. repository.rName: Archivo gráfico institucional de la Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
repository.oName: Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
repository.postalAddress: C/Juan de Quesada, nº 30, Las Palmas de Gran Canaria

repository.uName: Escuela Nacional de Formación Electoral y del Estado Civil
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research and documents of the institution. The interface is in Spanish.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Most, but not all items in the repository are available as full text. Materials in the archive are available from 1973 to the present day. The institution has a background in the fine and applied arts, architecture, literature and social science disciplines; and as such the materials in this archive reflect that interest. Additional information on the repository is available in German only.

This site provides access to digitised maps of Central and Eastern Europe. The primary interface includes links to Polish and English versions of Mapywig. Sub-pages are devoted to Polish, German, Austro-Hungarian, Russian & Soviet and Allied mapping of the region. To facilitate access, all files are available through "mapster".
repository.rRemarks: Currently the majority of large, uniform map sets are searchable to provide a user with a list of available maps or town plans to match a searched location. The site is undergoing further development to increase image resolution, fill gaps of coverage and ease of searching.

repository.postalAddress: University of Olso, P.O. Box 1072, Blindern, 0316 Oslo
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based institutional repository from the Centre for European Studies. It is split into three sections Reprints (postprints and monographs), Working papers (preprints & working papers) and Reports. The Reprints and Reports lists are bibliographic citations only, rather than full text. Some of the older (pre 1997) working papers are also bibliographic entries only. Thus the repository size figure represents only the full-text materials on the site. The site interface is in English. The site is also indexed on the European Research Papers Archive (ERPA).

repository.rName: ARES - ACERVO DE RECURSOS EDUCACIONAIS EM SAÚDE
repository.rDescription: The Collection of Educational Resources in Health (Acervo de Recursos Educacionais em Saúde – ARES) is a repository of educational resources which are openly acessible. It is maintained by the Executive Office of the Open University of the Brazilian Health System (UNA-SUS), and is aimed at health workers across the country providing care training needs and continuing education for these workers. The website is in Portuguese.

repository.uName: Facultad de Humanidades y Ciencias Sociales
repository.rDescription: Argos is the Institutional Repository of the Ministry of Research and Graduate Studies, Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, National University of Misiones, which stores and maintains the scientific information generated by academic staff. repository.oName: Ingemmet - Instituto Geologico Minero y Metalurgico
repository.rDescription: The Virtual Library of Geological, Mining and Metallurgical Institute of Peru, is the on-line institutional digital repository on Peruvian geology which is updated regularly.It is produced by research INGEMMET, Directorate of Environmental Geology and Geological Risk, Regional Directorate of Geology and the Department of Minerals and Energy Resources. Presentations, Papers and Posters presented by our research scientists are also published. Its use is free of charge, provided it is cited as the source of origin to INGEMMET. The interface is in Spanish and it contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.

The books date from the early years of printing to the 1930's for books written in the Arabic script and up to 1811 for books written in the Latin alphabet.

repository.uName: Centre d'études Supérieures de la Renaissance

Principal materials are a wide range of digitised books from the period, available as a series of page images. The site interface is available in French only. Whilst the site has aspirations to include 2000 items over the coming years, there remains a considerable amount of work to achieve this target.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Centre d'Études Supérieures de la Renaissance (Université François-Rabelais - CNRS), Institut de Recherche et d'Histoire des Textes (CNRS)

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Spanish and English and contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.

This subject based repository site contains articles solely from two authors (Shimshon Bichler and Jonathan Nitzan) working in the area of political economy. A monthly email alert is available for interested parties to be informed of new material added to the site.

repository.oName: Bibliothèque Interuniversitaire de la Communauté française de Belgique
repository.rDescription: This repository provides access to phD theses output of the French Community of Belgium. Participating institutions are Faculté Polytechnique de Mons, Faculté Universitaire des Sciences Agronomiques de Gembloux, Facultés Universitaires Catholiques de Mons, Facultés Universitaires Notre-Dame de la Paix de Namur, Facultés Universitaires Saint-Louis, Université catholique de Louvain, Université Libre de Bruxelles, Université de Liège and Université de Mons-Hainaut.

This site is an institutional repository providing full text access to the dissertations and theses produced at the University of Liege, notably those submitted from October 2006 onwards. Not all theses are accessible via open access, with some restricted to local users only. However, the site is exceptionally clear in this demarcation using a two colour scheme to indicate the difference. The site interface is in French, but queries can be made in French or English. The site includes a range of guidance and background information.

This is the Digital Repository Catholic University Lumen Gentium Foundation. The interface is available in Spanish, Italian, French, German and English and includes RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Currently only holds images.

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional based repository for conference proceedings. The site interface is available in both English and German versions. At time of initial review, only conferences concerning informatics and computing have been added.

This site is an institutional digital archive containing a variety of materials deposited by the librarians. These include journals of the German enlightenment, manuscripts and digitised rare prints from the 15th to 20th century. Each section has its own interface and search engine. The site is available in English and German, with portions of the search interface in the latter only.
This site provides access to the records of the institution. The interface is available in French and includes RSS feeds.

repository.postalAddress: Badia Fiesolana, Via dei Roccettini 9, I-50014 San Domenico di Fiesole (FI), Florence
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. As such the contents reflect the interests of the institution covering such areas as history, law, economics, politics and social sciences. Many items are available in full-text; however some items are only listed as metadata (bibliographic) entries. The figure for size given here reflects the total number of records, and includes both full and non-full text items. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The site interface is in English, as are many of the papers. However, due to the international outlook and intake of the institution articles in many European languages can be found within this repository.
repository.rRemarks: Other languages include Polish

repository.rDescription: This is the institutional repository for Cairo University which contains technical reports, and regulations and policies as well as manuscripts, rare books and historical photographs and archival documents. The interface is in English and Arabic

repository.rName: Calhoun, Institutional Archive of the Naval Postgraduate School
repository.postalAddress: Public Affairs Office – Code 004, 1 University Circle, Monterey, CA 93943
repository.rDescription: Calhoun is the Institutional Archive of the Naval Postgraduate School. Calhoun offers access to NPS-authored documents including graduate theses, dissertations, technical reports, scholarly articles, journals and historical materials related to NPS. The interface is in English.

repository.rName: California State University Channel Islands Institutional Repository
repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository providing access to the materials and work of the faculty and student body. Not all the items are available as open access, with some requiring local login and authentication to access. Registered local users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added materials.
repository.rRemarks: Other items include: Channel Islands View student newspaper & university documentation.

repository.postalAddress: 1200 E California, Mail Code 1-32, Pasadena, CA 91125
repository.rDescription: This is a small institutionally based repository containing transcripts of interviews with notable Caltech members of staff. The audio portions of the interviews are not provided on this site. Part of the Caltech Online Digital Archives (CODA) project.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

repository.postalAddress: 1200 E California, Mail Code 1-32, Pasadena, CA 91125
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to the publication output of Caltech. The largest proportion of this repository is made up of post-print articles. Materials are available from 1914 to the present day. As would be expected the technical nature of the institution means that these works are largely concerned with aspects of applied mathematics, science and technology. Each of the works included are reviewed and certified by at least one faculty member in the department before addition to the site. Part of the Caltech Online Digital Archives (CODA) project. The interface is in English and it includes RSS feeds to alert users of new content.
repository.rRemarks: Incorporates Caltech Books

repository.postalAddress: 1200 E California, Mail Code 1-32, Pasadena, CA 91125
repository.rDescription: The Caltech Archives holds approximately 220 collections of the papers of distinguished Caltech professors, administrators and alumnae. This is a repository of finding aids, which are guides to historical documents. The documents themselves are open for research at the Caltech Archives to qualified users. Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in English.

repository.postalAddress: 1200 E California, Mail Code 1-32, Pasadena, CA 91125
repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository providing access to the student theses produced at the university. By the nature of the university the majority of the theses available on this site are in areas of applied science, mathematics and technology. However, a small number of social science related theses are mounted on this site. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. the interface is in English.

repository.postalAddress: 1200 E California, Mail Code 1-32, Pasadena, CA 91125

repository.rRemarks: CaltechCONF is part of CODA, the Caltech Collection of Open Digital Archives, managed by Caltech Library Services.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in Italian.

repository.uName: Digital Library Projects at the University of Pennsylvania
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository, focussing on the contributions of women writers throughout history and aiming to promote awareness of the breadth and variety of women's writing. There are about 300 texts available on the local server, others are made available via links to external sites although some of these links no longer work. Many texts are in English but there is a small proportion in other languages.

repository.oName: Institut national de recherche en sciences et technologies pour l'environnement et l'agriculture
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The majority of items are only available as bibliographic records, however a few clearly marked full-text items are available. The interface is available in a mixture of French and English.

repository.rName: Center for Jewish History Digital Collections
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository for materials pertaining to Jewish history. The site is especially rich in digitised books, posters and other images relating to aspects of Jewish history. The site has a good user interface allowing easy filtering and review of items found through the custom search engine. Context sensitive help is available on each page via the question-mark symbol.

repository.rName: Central and Eastern European Marine Repository
repository.oName: Institute of Biology of the Southern Seas
repository.rDescription: This is a subject repository covering marine, brackish and freshwater environments. This site provides access to research by staff of the ECET countries institutes. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Repository is divided into the communities of the institutions involved.

repository.rName: Central Archive at the University of Reading
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the institution's research output. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.

repository.rName: Central Connecticut State University Digital Collections
repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository. Masters theses are available from 1998 onwards, with dissertations available 2005 onwards. Other content included posters, rare publications, oral histories and GLBTQ archives. The interface is in English.

repository.rName: Central de Informações sobre Cooperação Jurídica Internacional (Information Center on International Legal Cooperation)
repository.oName: Conselho Nacional de Justiça (National Council of Justice)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the work and documentation of the institution. The interface is in English and Spanish. Items include international agreements, instruments of cooperation, treaties & articles. Users may setup RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.rName: Central Economics and Mathematics Institute RAS
repository.rDescription: This in an institutional repository containing the research output of CEMI (Цэми). It contains metadata and selected full texts, as well as the tables of contents of certain journals.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. While all subjects researched by the institution are valid for deposition, as of this audit, materials principally related to computing and mathematics have been deposited. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The site interface is in English.

repository.oName: Institute of Museum and Library Services
repository.postalAddress: 1800 M Street NW, 9th Floor, Washington, DC 20036-5802
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to a digital collection of historical material about Central Florida, as well as resources for history education about the region.

This site provides access to the research output of the institutions staff and students. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English. Some items are not available as full text.

repository.rName: Central Michigan University's Online Digital Object Repository (CONDOR)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution. Includes clear guidance.

repository.oName: Central School of Speech and Drama
repository.postalAddress: Embassy Theatre, 62-64 Eton Ave, London, NW3 3HY
repository.rDescription: this is the open access repository of Central School of Speech and Drama which contains open access to its research and other creative outputs. The repository represents a range of work at the School, including scholarly publications, practice-research outcomes, selected transcripts and recordings of research events, and instances of new theatre production.
repository.rRemarks: This system is running eprints server software (EPrints 3.2.3 (Battenburg) [Born on 2010-07-01]) developed at the University of Southampton. For more information see http://www.eprints.org/

repository.rName: Centre pour la numérisation de sources visuelles
repository.oName: Centre de Recherche en Histoire des Sciences et des Techniques
repository.oAcronym: CNRS (Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is in French. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.rName: Centro de Recursos para la Enseñanza y el Aprendizaje
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to Learning Objects from the institution. The interface is in Spanish.
repository.rRemarks: Some files are in .EXE format, others require a Shockwave Flash Player.

repository.rDescription: CERIST DL is the institutional repository of the Research Centre for Scientific and Technical Information, which has an online archive providing access to the entire production of CERIST. It includes scientific and academic research, audiovisual and related production. It was created to facilitate the deposit of digital content conference papers, technical reports or research, theses, course materials and other items. The interface is in French and it contains RSS feeds to alert users of new content.
repository.rRemarks: Many items require a login to view the content, but there are some items that are freely available. The Digital Library is currently in Beta.

repository.oName: Organisation Européenne pour la Recherche Nucléaire
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository for the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). The site is well supported with a vast range of guidance documentation for academics and researchers wishing to constitute materials. The site interface is available in 19 languages and includes a meeting scheduler tool.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Standards

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Spanish.

This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Many items are not available as full-text. Some items provide links to full-text held elsewhere. The interface is available in Swedish and English.

repository.rName: Chaoyang University of Technology Institutional Repository
repository.oName: Chaoyang University of Technology (朝陽科技大學)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Interface available in Chinese and Chinese (simplified) and English. A few items are not available as full-text.

repository.rName: Charles Darwin University's Institutional Digital Repository
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English.

This site is an institutional repository which stores and makes available research written and created by academics. Not all items are available in full text, although bibliographic citations are available for all. The repository accepts a wide variety of material, Including books, book chapters, journal articles, conference papers, presentation, and datasets. Registered users can subscribe to email alerts and RSS feeds to notify them of newly added content. The site is well supported with guidance and help materials.

repository.rName: Chia Nan University of Pharmacy & Science Institutional Repository

repository.rName: Chiba University's Repository for Access To Outcomes from Research
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The site interface is available in English or Japanese and includes an RSS feed to alert users to new content.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Chinese and English. Many items are not available as full-text.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include Speeches

repository.rName: Chinese Culture University Institutional Repository(中國文化大學機構典藏)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Interface available in Chinese and Chinese (simplified) and English. A few items are not available as full-text.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in a mixture of Japanese and English.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the student output of the institution. The interface is available in Chinese, Chinese (simplified) and English. Some items are not available as full texts.

repository.rName: Chung Yuan Christian University Institutional Repository
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Some items are not available as full-text. The interface is available in English, Chinese. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.postalAddress: Km 17, Recta Cali-Palmira, Apartado Aéreo 6713, Cali,

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English and Spanish.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English.
This is an institutional repository preserving the scholarly output of the University community. This repository mainly contains theses and dissertations.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include student final year projects.

repository.rDescription: This is an archive of civil documents relating to the Ukraine. The interface is in Ukrainian.

This site provides access to research output and collections from 5 undergraduate and 2 graduate institutions across a wide spectrum of disciplines. Items can be search by type. The interface is in English.

repository.postalAddress: BMA House, Tavistock Square, London, WC1H 9JP
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to non-peer reviewed original research relating to the relevant discipline. As of May 2005, the site no longer accepts new manuscripts for submission. Existing articles can be browsed by author, title or subject. The site is well supported with background information and guidance material.

This site provides users with access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content. Some items are not available as full text, however the 'Request Copy' forms can be used for documents to which direct full-text download is restricted due to publisher embargo.
This site provides access to digitised copies of historical manuscripts. The interface is available in English, French, German and Italian.

This site is a subject based repository for all areas of cognitive science, including related areas of philosophy, biology and mathematics. While the principle language of the materials deposited on this site is English, there are a few articles available in other languages. Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.rName: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Institutional Repository
repository.rDescription: This is the institutional repository of Cold Harbour springs laboratory which contains the work of their scientists. Most items are freely available, but many journal articles are accessed through links to the publisher website. The interface is in English and contains RSS feeds to alert users of new content.
repository.rRemarks: Ticking "Unpublished" on Advanced Search will display original, open access materials.

repository.postalAddress: Sta. Catarina Mártir, Cholula, Puebla, C.P. 72820

This site provides access to artworks and related materials from the permanent collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Many of the images can be freely used for Scholarly Content and these are marked with an OASC Open Access for Scholarly Content icon. The interface is in English.
This repository contains the official Collegio Carlo Alberto Notebooks. The interface is in English and Italian.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in German.

repository.rName: Colorado State University Libraries Digital Repository
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to the research output of the institution. The interface is in English.

repository.rName: Combined Arms Research Library Digital Library
repository.postalAddress: Eisenhower Hall, Fort Levenworth, 250 Gibbon Ave, KS 66027-2314
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository of digitised documents from the CARL collections. The content is split into 11 sub collections, which include General Staff College theses. While the majority of items are freely available, certain items and theses may well be restricted for various reasons.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Web links.

repository.rDescription: This is a digital library of open access books and reports from the Comenius Institut which mainly contains theological resources. The interface is in German or English.

CommonKnowledge is the home of the collected scholarship and creative works of Pacific University faculty, staff and students - and of their collaborators from around the world. These open collections, organized and made accessible by the Pacific University Libraries, demonstrate Pacific's commitment to the idea that shared information and academic collaboration are essential to the "progress of knowledge" in our global community. the interface is in English and includes an RSS feed to alert users to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Certain items need a log in and others only have meta data records.

repository.rDescription: The Common Repository is an initiative by the library of the University of Malaya to preserve printed items digitally to increase accessibility, visibility as well as conserve old copies of items such as gazettes, magazines, journals and books. The interface is in English and includes RSS feeds to alert users of new content.
This site provides access to the output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in Japanese.

repository.rName: Computer Laboratory Technical Reports - Cambridge University
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based institutional repository providing access to the technical reports from the university's Computer Laboratory. All reports published from 2002 onwards are present, with a portion of those produced prior to this date available. Of the 739 reports issued the size value given here reflects the number that are available as full-text. The interface is in English.
This site provides access to the research output of the department. The interface is available in English. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.oName: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
repository.rDescription: This subject based institutional repository is part of the NCSTRL collection of computer science reports. As such the majority of items in the repository are technical reports, rather than published articles.

repository.rDescription: COMU is the institutional repository of Canakkale Onsekiz Mart University. It gives open access to the work of staff and students. the interface is in Turkish or English and contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.

repository.postalAddress: 1455 De Maisonneuve Blvd. West, Montreal, Quebec, Canada H3G 1M8
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in English.

This extensive and well configured aggregating repository collects together materials for use in creating secondary and tertiary education courses. The site allows, and indeed encourages, the reuse and adaptation of content into new learning objects. Principle language of content is English, however materials in all languages are acceptable for deposit on this site. Originally know as the Secret Web Initiative.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: William and Flora Hewlett Foundation, Maxfield Foundation, and the Connexions Consortium.

repository.rName: Consortium for the Advancement of Undergraduate Statistics Education
repository.uName: Consortium for the Advancement of Undergraduate Statistics Education
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository of resources for advanced undergraduate statistics education. It contains the publication output and a substantial number of resources gathered by the Consortium for the Advancement of Undergraduate Statistics Education. The bulk of the material is provided via links to external sources.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in French. Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.postalAddress: 7900 West Division St. River Forest, IL 60305
repository.rDescription: This site is a collaborative repository, providing access to the research outputs of Benedictine University, Dominican University, Elmhurst College, Lewis University, Trinity Christian College and Wheaton College. The interface is available in English.

repository.rDescription: CORA Cork Open Research Archive is the institutional repository of University College Cork, Ireland. repository.rRemarks: Resources on CORUS support participatory research. These include: evaluation tools, educational modules, proposals for seed funding, organizational strategies and other useful items. Users of the site are encouraged to upload relevant documents, share resources with peers, and engage in discussions with other users about the resources on the site.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in Hungarian and English.

repository.rName: Council of Independent Colleges Historic Campus Architecture Project

repository.rDescription: This institutional repository contains over 3000 dissertations defended at University of Novi Sad. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Many items do not have full-text available. The interface can be set to Welsh or English.
repository.rRemarks: Links to publishers websites are provided for the full text of most articles

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the digitised collections held throughout the institution. The interface is available in a variety of languages. Some content may be held on other urls within the institution.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include physical objects

repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to the publication output relating to the relevant discipline. Users can get updates on the latest papers submitted by RSS feeds and articles can be accessed in postscript, gzipped postscript, or PDF formats.
This is a subject based repository for datasets pertaining to crystallography and making available structure atomic coordinates in a rapid fashion. The site interface is in English.

repository.oName: Council for Scientific and Industrial Research
repository.rDescription: This repository provides access to research outputs generated by CSIR scientists. Registered users can receive email updates when new content is added. The interface is in English.

repository.oName: Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation
repository.rDescription: This repository contains records of more than 80 years of CSIRO research publications, such as journal articles, conference papers, books and reports. repository.postalAddress: Ellis Street, Thurgoona, New South Wales
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Some items are not available as full-text. Some full-text is only available to registered users.

repository.rDescription: This site provides a visual glossary of foreign language terms. The interface is in English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.All images found on this site are licensed under a Creative Commons 3.0 US License.

CumInCAD is a cumulative index of publications about computer aided architectural design. CumInCAD includes bibliographic information and other records from journals and conferences such as ACADIA, ASCAAD, CAADRIA, eCAADe, SiGraDi, CAAD futures, DDSS and others. repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the student output of the institution. The interface is available in Spanish, French or English.

repository.postalAddress: Suite 0944 Defense Technical Information Center, 8725 John J. Kingman Road, Fort Belvoir, VA 22060-6218
repository.rDescription: This military based subject repository contains nearly 1 million citations and over 140,000 full-text declassified reports that document the results of Defence-sponsored research, development, test and evaluation (RDT&E) efforts. A sophisticated set of search and browse functions are available for technical reports, DTIC Thesaurus and Corporate Sources involved in related work. The site is complemented by a wide range of supporting documentation. A range of Special Collection items, grouped in subject categories are also available on this extensive site. The interface is in English.

repository.rName: Dehesa. Repositorio Institucional de la Universidad de Extremadura
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research students output of the institution. The interface is available in Spanish, Portuguese and English.

This site is an institutional repository of research and other publications produced by university faculty and students. Registered users may set up email alerts to notify them of newly added materials. Though the site highlights theses as items within the repository, only a limited number of them are currently present.
repository.rRemarks: Downloads or papers can be slow even over fast institutional networks. Special items include: Newspaper clippings

repository.rName: DENISON Digital Resource Commons: Denison University Herbarium
repository.rDescription: This project aims to catalog and digitize all of the specimens collected over nearly 150 years in our collection. The earliest specimens in Denison University herbarium date from the mid to late 1800s. The interface is in English and includes an RSS feed to alert users to new content.

repository.rName: DENISON Digital Resource Commons: Denison Virtual Earth Material Gallery
repository.rDescription: This virtual gallery is a sampling of the upward of 9,000 specimens from the Denison Geosciences Earth materials collection previously only cataloged in a manuscript book (Figure 1.a and b) started by Prof. Clarence L. Herrick (Figure 1.c) in the 1890s. The items in the collection are varied, from representative mineral samples (Figure 1.d - Galena, quartz, rhodochrosite), to rocks from important geologic locations.The interface is in English and it includes an RSS feed to alert users to new content.

repository.rName: DENISON Digital Resource Commons: History of Fashion
repository.rDescription: The Denison University History of Fashion Collection is a teaching and learning tool that provides access to images of over 350 garments and accessories from 1830 through the 20th Century. Students in Costume Design and History of Fashion courses will provide additional descriptive information to these items over time. The interface is in English.

repository.oName: Kings College London, University of London

repository.rName: Depósito Académico Digital de la Universidad de Navarra

repository.rName: Depósito de Dissertações e Teses Digitais
repository.uName: Direcção de Serviços de Inovação e Desenvolvimento
repository.rDescription: This site is a repository for thesis and dissertations produced in 5 Portuguese universities who are members of DiTeD. The National Library of Portugal is also a contributing member. The material in the repository is a mix of a small number of fully accessible theses, a large majority of partial files and a small quantity of those theses for whom bibliographic (metadata) records are available only. Interestingly the majority of the records and theses are for those published in the areas of art, recreation, entertainment and sports studies. The site interface is available in Portuguese, English and Italian, although information on the DiTeD programme is only available in the original native language.

repository.rRemarks: The individuals interviewed include business men and women, scientists, authors, actors and other people in the media talking about their lives and motivations. The archive provides a useful social commentary.

This site provides access to research datasets relating to published peer-reviewed articles. Dryad repository accepts research datasets relating to published peer-reviewed articles. This site has an initial focus on evolutionary biology, ecology and related fields. Dryad’s faceted search interface can be used to find related content in other repositories. Authors may also use the submission interface to submit to more than one repository.

This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is in English.
This is the institutional repository for Novosibirsk State University. The interface is in Russian and contains RSS feeds so that users may set up alerts for new content.

This is an institutional repository providing access to the collections and research of the institution. The interface is in Greek. Some items are only available to registered users. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Magazines

repository.rName: DSpace at Odessa I.I.Mechnikov National University
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English, Ukrainian and Russian. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

University repository providing access to the publication output of the institution, with many items denoting their date of formal publication. While some items require registration to view, this registration is offered freely to all. Registered users, not limited to institutional members, can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The interface is in English and contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.

This site is a pilot university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. It is especially rich in photographic images principally of value to historians, sociologists and political researchers. Whilst these images are taken from materials published by Rice University, they are not solely concerned with the historical aspects of the institution's development. Only registered users can access some data (mainly images) from certain collections, which somewhat detracts from the external usability of this site. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content.

This site is a developing university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. While theses and dissertations are listed as available, all that is accessible are the three or so page summary overviews; the full documents are not viewable on this site. As the site is still under development this situation and the range of documentation available may well alter in due course. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The site interface is in English.

repository.rName: DSpace at School of Computing, NUS
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based institutional repository making publications of the School of Computing openly accessible . Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. A certain level of encryption and security is embedded in the site which may cause some users accessibility problems. Some theses, dissertations and programme reports are restricted in access to members of the institution only, however the titles of these records remain are accessible to all.

repository.postalAddress: State University Plaza, 353 Broadway, Albany, NY 12246
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The site is especially rich in photographs and images of educational, scholarly and general interest as they make up the vast majority of items archived. The interface is in English and contains RSS feeds to alert users of new content.

repository.oName: Sudan University of Science and Technology

repository.postalAddress: MacKimmie Library Tower MLT-404, 2500 University Drive NW, Calgary
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content A certain level of encryption and security is embedded in the site. This may cause some users a problem in achieving full site, and is certainly annoyance when browsing using Internet Explorer. Some materials are restricted to members of the institution, or members of specific research groups or projects. Despite the large number of items listed on this site, the vast majority are bibliographic catalogue listings only; the full text is not openly accessible. The openly accessible material is currently in the region of 1,000 items.

repository.postalAddress: University of Amsterdam, De Boelelaan 1103, 1081 HV Amsterdam
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution, which includes a section dedicated to the Cream of Science. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. A certain level of encryption and security is embedded in the site. This may cause some users accessibility problems. Some items are not available as Open Access full-text but are listed as bibliographic entries. However, it is not easy to distinguish which or how many of the number of entries on the site are restricted in this manner and the size listed is that of all VU-DARE entries. The site interface is in English, with some additional information in English and Dutch. VU-DARE is integrated in NARCIS, the gateway to scholarly information in The Netherlands, which is part of DANS (Data Archiving and Networked Services), an institute of KNAW and NWO.

Most of the theses on this site are open access, however, the facility exists to make them restricted or gated access.

University repository currently providing access to the publication output of the institution. Includes a paper of the day highlighted. Registered users, not limited to institutional members, can set up email alerts or an RSS feed to notify them of newly added relevant content.

repository.rName: ePubs: the open archive for STFC research publications
repository.postalAddress: Polaris House, North Star Avenue, Swindon, SN2 1SZ
repository.rDescription: ePubs is the open archive of the Science and Technology Facilities Council. It records the scientific and technical output of STFC staff and facilities users and makes it freely available online. The ePubs archive contains records and selected files of publications produced by researchers based at STFC facilities. As well as current publications, ePubs includes many records of publications from STFC’s predecessor organisations, CCLRC, SERC, SRC and NIRNS, as part of its aim to preserve a true archival record of the organisations’ output. The oldest publication records date from 1957.The interface is available in English and Welsh.
repository.rRemarks: ePubs is managed for STFC by the Chadwick and RAL Libraries.

repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository for Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam, providing access to the research output of the institution. Registered users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content.

The site itself is well laid out with a good range of browse, search and filtering options available for the user. There is also a fair assortment of background information, although this is mostly slanted towards those seeking funding than end users of this repository site.

repository.rDescription: This is a repository providing access to theses that have been deposited by individuals who belong to an institution lacking in a ETD or similar open access repository. While the principal language of the site is English, due to the global nature of the eligible depositing community many other languages are represented in the available materials.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Networked Digital Library of Theses and Dissertations (NDLTD)

repository.postalAddress: Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich, ETH Zurich, Raemistrasse 101, 8092 Zurich
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. As such the collection presents materials relating to the core interest of the institution of science and technology. The site interface is in German and English and is supported by guidance documentation in both languages.

repository.rName: Etheses - A Saurashtra University Library Service
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.rName: Ethics in Science and Engineering National Clearinghouse
repository.rDescription: This site provides is a beta site for a national digital library for ethics in science and engineering is designed to benefit the national and international scientific and engineering research communities. Some items are not available as full-text. The interface is in English. This project is sponsored by National Science Foundation Office of Integrative Research. The project is a direct response to the America COMPETES Act, which, beginning January 4, 2010, will require "that each institution that applies for financial assistance from the Foundation for science and engineering research or education describe in its grant proposal a plan to provide appropriate training and oversight in the responsible and ethical conduct of research to undergraduate students, graduate students, and postdoctoral researchers participating in the proposed research project" (Section 7009) and "that all grant applications that include funding to support postdoctoral researchers include a description of the mentoring activities that will be provided for such individuals" (Section 7008).
repository.rRemarks: Special items include Case Studies . A new site will be developed by University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign to host materials related to the study of Ethics.

repository.rName: ETSU Electronic Thesis and Dissertation Archive
repository.postalAddress: 807 University Pkwy, Johnson City, P.O. Box 70720, TN 37604
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the student theses output of the institution. The interface is in English and contains an RSS feed to alert users to new content.

repository.postalAddress: Campus SophiaTech,, 450 Route des Chappes,, 06410, Biot
repository.rDescription: Some items are not available as full-text. The site interface is available in French and English.

repository.postalAddress: Osney One Building, Osney Mead, Oxford, OX2 0EW
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Many items are not available as full-text. The interface is in English.

repository.oName: Alexander Technological Educational Institute of Thessaloniki
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The site interface is available in Greek or English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Note: Difficulties may occur trying to access from within a network

repository.rDescription: This is a subject based repository, that mirrors the data held on the PubMed Central site. Since 2010, the service diversified from PMC and introduced additional content including PubMed abstracts and biological patents. In addition this site acts as an Open Access repository for peer-reviewed research from researchers who have been funded by the Europe PMC Funders Group - submitted via the Europe PMC Manuscript Submission System A range of supporting guidance and background information are available on this site.
repository.rRemarks: Launched as UK PubMed Central (UKPMC) in January 2007, changed to Europe PubMed Central in November 2012. Special item types include: Links

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional subject based repository, containing materials produced by the members of the European Centre for Minority Issues, as well as papers published within their journal by other scholars.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: ECMI Ethnopolitical Map of Europe, Newsletters, Annual Reports and ECMI Handbooks

repository.postalAddress: Max Plank Institute for the History of Science, Hofgartenstr. 8, 80539 München
repository.rDescription: This site is a pilot repository that gathers and provides seed collections of content relating to the cultural and scientific heritage of Europe. The intent behind the pilot sit is to attempt to create a social network of likeminded producers and users of such information who will be willing to contribute material to the site. The site interface is available in English. Special items include: Links to external resources
This site provides access to the output of the European Document Centre of the institution. The interface is available in Greek.

repository.postalAddress: c/o the Koninklijke Bibliotheek, National Library of the Netherlands, PO Box 90407, 2509 LK The Hague
repository.rDescription: The European Film Gateway gives access to around 2900 historic films related to the First World War. The interface can be set to many languages.
repository.rRemarks: The films cover different genres like newsreels, documentaries, fiction and propaganda and have to be considered of special importance since only around 20% of the complete silent film production survived in the film heritage institutions. Therefore, the films searchable through the European Film Gateway constitute a crucial part of these remaining moving image records.

repository.postalAddress: Institut für Technikfolgen-Abschätzung, Österreichische Akademie der Wissenschaften, Strohgasse 45/5, A-1030 Wien
repository.rDescription: This site is an aggregating repository that contains a collection of research papers from ten European institutions. The site contains working papers on European Integration. The site interface is in English but several papers are written in French and German.

repository.postalAddress: c/o the Koninklijke Bibliotheek, National Library of the Netherlands, PO Box 90407, 2509 LK The Hague
repository.rDescription: This is an archive of stories, films and historical material about the First World War. Europeana 1914-1918 mixes resources from libraries and archives across the globe with memories and memorabilia from families throughout Europe. The interface is in English.

repository.rName: Euskal Doktorego Tesien Bilduma - Repositorio de Tesis Doctorales
repository.rDescription: This repository provides access to thesis on Basque Studies. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
This site provides access to digital scans of monographs relating to Basque culture. The interface is available in English, Spanish and Basque.

repository.rName: eVols at University of Hawaii at Manoa
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to digitised material within the University of Hawaii at Manoa Library. The interface is in English.

repository.postalAddress: Plot No-A/2, Jahurul Islam City, Aftabnagar, Dhaka 1212
repository.rDescription: EWU Digital Library provides open access to different works of the faculty members, staff and students of the different departments, and will be expanding its resources in the future. The interface is in English.

repository.postalAddress: Plot No-A/2, Jahurul Islam City, Aftabnagar, Dhaka 1212
repository.rDescription: This is the Institutional Repository of East West University. The interface is in English and it contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.

repository.postalAddress: Blekinge Institute of Technology, SE-371 79 Karlskrona
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository for undergraduate and post graduate dissertations. The site is available mainly in Swedish, although English phrases are offered as alternate options throughout the site, and some guidance is also available in this language.

repository.uName: Exploratorium: The museum of science, art and human perception
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to a collection of teaching resources and learning activities that reflect the museum’s foundation of playful exhibit-based inquiry in science, art, and human perception. The Exploratorium received funding from the National Science Foundation in 2003 to launch this site. Some items require a fee for reuse.
repository.rRemarks: Special items: Websites, experiments

repository.rDescription:
Explore Bristol Research provides access to the research activities of the institution.
The site includes research profiles, publications, and activities.
The OAI-PMH feed is limited to include only publications that have associated full text files. It is intended that student theses will be included in the site and OAI-PMH feed by the end of 2014.
The interface is available in English.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The interface is available in German only. Additionally, this site allows users to search across 10 other university repositories.

repository.postalAddress: Stuttgart University of the Media, Nobelstrasse 10, 70569 Stuttgart
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. repository.oName: Deutsches Institut für Internationale Pädagogische Forschung (German Institute for International Educational Research)

repository.oName: Høgskolen i Oslo og Akershus (Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Norwegian. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.uName: Faculty of Mechanical engineering and Naval Architecture
repository.postalAddress: University of Zagreb, Trg maršala Tita 14, HR-10000, Zagreb
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository of theses and dissertations of Faculty of Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture. Dissertations and theses submitted 2004 onwards will be mainly available in full text, with items prior to this date available in abstract only. Currently overall coverage is 1997-date. Some materials are restricted in access to members of the local institution, but these are clearly marked on the site with a padlock. Bibliographic data is available for these entries however. The site interface is mainly in Croatian; however most major functions are also given in English. Abstracts are commonly duplicated into both, although full-text content is primarily the former language.

repository.oName: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research and publication output of the institution. The site interface is available in Arabic, English, French and Spanish. Users may select to browse for full-text items only. Some items are not available as full-text.

repository.oName: Facultad de Agronomía Universidad de Buenos Aires

repository.rDescription: FAUBA Digital is the Institutional Repository of the Faculty of Agriculture at the University of Buenos Aires. It provides open access to the work and research of staff and students. The interface is available in a wide variety of languages.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The site interface is available in Swedish, Norwegian and English. Some items are not available as full-text.
This is the institutional repository of the Federal University Oye Ekiti.The interface is in English and includes RSS feeds to alert users to new content.

Federal University Oye-Ekiti Institutional Repository is an online store for collecting, preserving, and disseminating intellectual output of the University in digital form. The interface is in English and it contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
This site provides access to the administrative and research output of the institution.

This site provides access to a collection of Spanish, Hispano-American, Brazilian and Portuguese scholars from various time periods and other ancient works. This site is available in Spanish or English and contains an RSS feed to alert users to new items. Some content is held on external websites.
repository.rRemarks: For each author a MARC21/RDA authority record is made and is enriched with biographical data. This can be access via a seperate OAI-PMH url: http://www.larramendi.es/i18n/oai/oai_aut.cmd

The FOSS repository includes content produced by the Greek Free / Open Source Software Society (its members, communities and developers) as a result of activities related to Free Software, Open Hardware and Open Content. It provides open access to rich content such as reports, presentations, digital collections, conference proceedings, studies, videos and photos. . Registered users can submit their work online and contribute to the repository. The interface is in English and Greek.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to foundation-sponsored research reports and publications covering the full scope of philanthropic activity. repository.rDescription: The Gateway is an online repository of Oklahoma history. Currently it contains many newspaper pages dating from the 1840s to the 1920s which can be viewed and searched. Other items will be added in the future.

The site lists over 8,000 items, however the number listed here represents those that are available in Openly Accessible full-text; although bibliographic records are visible to all. The site interface is in English or German.

This site is an repository contain materials produced by academics working in the area of communication technologies for teaching and training (ICTT). The site interface is available in English and French.

It is notable that this site is a companion to the Glasgow ePrints service, which contains the post-print articles for the institution. This site has some encryption and security, which may cause some people difficulties when attempting to access or search it remotely. Registered users can sign-up for regular email alerts to notify them of newly added and relevant content. The interface is in English.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution. The interface is in English. Users may set up an RSS feed to be alerted to new content.

repository.oName: National Aeronautics and Space Administration, Goddard Space Flight Center
repository.rDescription: The Goddard Library Repository is developed and managed by the Goddard Library and is designed to store, distribute, and preserve digital publications and other resources created by NASA Goddard Space Flight Center. The Repository content consists of collections produced or controlled by the Goddard community. A collection is a group of digital objects and metadata related to the work of the Goddard Space Flight Center and the Wallops Flight Facility. The Repository includes items in a variety of formats, including text, images, audio, and video. Types of material that may be in the collections include: journal articles, conference and workshop papers and presentations, book chapters, Goddard Colloquium presentations, case studies, technical reports, images and other media, Goddard publications and historical documents, and special collections of documents related to a specific topic. The interface is in English.

repository.postalAddress: University of London, New Cross, London, SE14 6NW

repository.rDescription: This open access archive contains images of Irish medieval architecture and sculpture. The interface is in English.
This repository collates documents received as a result of Freedom of Information request in the USA. Registered users can submit reviews of the documents.

repository.rDescription: This site is a catalogue of historical maps, atlases and charts; which contains a few open access items. By and large the majority of the items available on this site are available in metadata forms only, and are held locally as physical objects. Only a very limited number of maps and book plates available openly accessible. Currently only the Schwedische Landesaufnahme maps are all available, and a browser plug-in is required for download before they may be correctly viewed. The site administrators notes that it is hoped to expand on the repository with additional materials in the future. The site interface is available in the German language only and is split into 12 subsections.

repository.oName: Ecole Nationale des Ponts et Chaussées
repository.rDescription: HAL - Ecole des Ponts ParisTech is the Ecole nationale des ponts et chaussées's Repository. Ecole nationale des ponts et chaussées is an Engineering School training high-level engineers in the fields of civil engineering, sustainable development, environmental science, mechanical engineering, physics, geotechnics, hydraulics, mathematics and computer science, urban development, transportation, economics. The interface is in French and English and has an RSS feed.

This site provides access to the research outputs of 14 hospitals that make up the University Hospital of Lyon named 'Hospices Civils de Lyon'. The interface is available in French and English. Users may set up an RSS feed to be alerted to new content.

repository.oName: L'Institut National de Physique Nucléaire et de Physique des Particules
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository for the 19 laboratories that make up the IN2P3 organisation. While much of the material is available in full text as represented by the size figure given here, some portions of the information are only bibliographic listings. Of this latter kind the repository lists 16,000 items. The site interface is in French with an English translation available, although some parts of the site are accessible in French only. Registered users can set up email alerts and a RSS feed is available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials. The site offers a reasonably sophisticated interface offering a range of browsing options including by laboratory organisation & by arXiv & IN2P3 subject categorisation. The material within the site reflects the scientific disciplines engaged with across the organisation including applied and theoretical sciences, mathematics and engineering.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Centre national de la recherche scientifique (CNRS)

repository.oName: Institut National de la Santé et la Recherche Médicale

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. A large portion of the repository is given over to providing over 4000 metadata (bibliographic) entries for theses and some other documents not available as full text. As such the size value given here refers to the overall number of records, rather than the Openly Accessible portion. The site interface is available in English or German, with the latter being the default language.

This site is a institutional consortia repository providing access to the publication output of the HELIN Consortium institutions. It is notable that while eleven academic libraries and fifteen health science libraries make up this group, currently only seven of them have deposited materials searchable via this site. Whilst the majority of the materials accessed via this site are hosted on the individual member repositories, there are materials pertaining to the HELIN Consortium archived on this server. Many theses & dissertations are only freely accessible for the first 24 pages to external users. However, beyond the first 24 pages theses are not openly accessible to non-institutional members. Subscribers to Digital Dissertations will be able to read the full-text. A RSS feed is available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials. Special items include: Student project reports & essays
This site provides access to the output of the institution. Contains research output by NHRF since its establishment in 1958. The interface is in Greek. Some items are not available as full text.

repository.rDescription: HAL is a tool for direct scientific communication between French researchers. The interface can be set to French or English.

ICOMOS Open Archive is a global archive specialising in the conservation and restoration of monuments, sites and landscapes. It is both the institutional archive of the scientific documentation produced by the International Council on Monuments and Sites (ICOMOS) and also a subject archive open to the entire international scientific community in the field of heritage conservation. Research institutes, organizations, universities and individual researchers involved in the conservation of cultural heritage and related fields, whether members of ICOMOS or not, are encouraged to make use of and contribute to this global Archive. The interface is in English and has an RSS feed.

repository.oName: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi Arid Tropics
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution. Some items are not available as full text. Full text items are clearly marked. The interface is available in English or Arabic. Users may set up an RSS feed to be alerted to new content.

repository.oName: Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to a publication output relating to any of the science and technology disciplines. Material deposited is not limited solely to scientific research, as matters of science education, policy and professional societies are also welcomed. For those users with slower Internet connections it is possible to email materials from the site rather than wait for them to download in the Web browser. While the site accepts materials from scientists working anywhere in the world the site interface is available in English, as are the vast majority of the contents

IRIS, is a digital library of the history of science and technology. It gives access to printed texts from the nineteenth to the beginning of the twentieth century. It focuses on the scientific and industrial heritage of the North of France and Wallonia.
The collections are intended for researchers, students, stakeholders working to promote scientific and technical culture and anyone wishing to discover the history of science. The interface can be in French, English or Dutch.
