repository.rDescription: Jable collects and preserves newspapers, magazines, newsletters and various periodicals which were made ​​in the Canary Islands; by a Canarian; or about the archipelago. The interface is in Spanish and English.
repository.rRemarks: This is an archive of newspaper and magazine articles about the Canary Isles covering dates from 1763 onwards.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the digitised collections of the institution. The interface is available in Polish and English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include Maps

repository.oName: Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology
repository.oAcronym: 北陸先端科学技術大学院大学
repository.rDescription: "JAIST Repository" is a digital collection for collecting, preserving, and allowing access to the intellectual output of JAIST. This site interface is in Japanese and English.
repository.rRemarks: Special items: Grants, JAIST Press publications

repository.oName: Japan Agency for Marine-Earth Science and Technology (JAMSTEC)
repository.oAcronym: 独立行政法人海洋研究開発機構
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution. Several items are not available as full-text. The interface is available in Japanese and English.

repository.rName: Japan International Cooperation Agency Research Institute Repository
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution.The site interface is available in English.

repository.postalAddress: Twickenham Park, Spanish Town, St. Catherine Jamaica
repository.rDescription: The JCF Seek is an online digital repository at the National Police College of Jamaica that collects, preserves, and distributes digital materials related to the JCF such as Force Orders, Policies, and Publications. This repository is an important tool for preserving the organization's legacy; it also facilitates digital preservation and scholarly communication. The interface is in English.
repository.rRemarks: Some of the items in the collections are only accessible to logged in users. To create an account you must have a JCF.gov.jm email address and click on the registration link

repository.uName: Jean Monnet Center for International and Regional Economic Law & Justice, NYU School of Law
repository.postalAddress: 70 Washington Square South, New York, NY 10012
repository.rDescription: Institutional subject based repository including material produced since 1995. A member of the European Research Papers Archive (ERPA).

Piloted in 2005 this serves a number of repository purposes for the institution including providing access to faculty work, student produced materials and as a university press. Registered users who do not have to be institutional members can set up RSS feeds and email alerts to notify them of new content addition. The site is well designed and is supported by a range of useful additional documents and information resources.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Academic & Instructional Support & Resources (ASIR)

repository.oName: Journal of Intercultural and Interdisciplinary Archaeology
repository.rDescription: This is a small subject based repository for archaeology, linked to the Journal of Intercultural and Interdisciplinary Archaeology, but including material from a variety of publications. The site interface is in English, although the full-text materials are not necessarily in this language.
This site provides access to the research output and collections of the institution. The interface is available in Japanese and English.

repository.postalAddress: Brettenham House (South Entrance), 5 Lancaster Place, London, WC2E 7EN
repository.rDescription: This repository provides access to the outputs from JISC funded repository projects. Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds.

repository.oName: Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology (JKUAT)
repository.rDescription: This is a new institutional repository for the Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology (JKUAT). IT currently contains a small number of openly accessible documents. The interface is in English and there are RSS feeds for user updates.

repository.postalAddress: Rua Jardim Botãnico 1008, Rio de Janeiro, Brasil
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the work of Antonio Carlos Jobim, composer of 'Girl from Ipanema', amongst many other bossa nova songs. The interface is available in English.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is in Japanese and English.

repository.rName: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health's OpenCourseWare
repository.uName: Johns Hopkins School of Public Health
repository.oName: University of Texas at San Antonio
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to a portion of the courseware used by the School of Public Health. The site is available in English or Chinese (both simplified and traditional). Each course includes at least a syllabus and lecture notes. The following are also included for some of the courses: assignments, reading lists and examination materials.
repository.rRemarks: Funders: William and Flora Hewlett Foundation.

repository.rName: Johnson and Wales University Scholars Archive
repository.rDescription: This repository provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up an RSS feed to be alerted to new content. Full-text of theses are provided by an external service.

This is a subject based organisational repository containing technical reports from 1993 to the present day. Detailed bibliographic information is available for all 190+ reports, however as of this writing only 153 items are available in a readable open access format. This repository forms part of the NASA Technical Report Server.

Jorum Open provides access to free learning and teaching resources, created and contributed by teaching staff from UK Further and Higher Education Institutions. This site is funded by JISC and run jointly by Mimas and EDINA, the two national data centres based at the Universities of Manchester and Edinburgh.
This site provides access to the research output of Josai University. The site interface is available in Japanese or English.

This site provides access to the research output of the centre. The interface is available in English. Users may setup RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Many items are not available as full-text.
This site is a repository of more than 9000 digital images from NASA'a Johnson Space Center's manned space program, provided in JPEG format.

This site is a governmental repository that contains photographs from NASA’s Reduced-Gravity Program, operated by the Johnson Space Center (JSC) in Houston, Texas. Some of the site has restricted access but most images including the student campaign photos can be viewed freely.
This is an institutional repository providing access to the collections and research of the institution. Some items are only available to registered users.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Maps

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output and historical collections of the institution. The interface is in French or English.

This is an institutional repository for the Research Centre Jülich providing access to the publication output of the institution. This site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation. registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The interface is in a mix of English and German.

repository.oName: Terveyden ja hyvinvoinnin laitos (National Institute for Health and Welfare)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Finish, Swedish or English.
This site provides access to the output of the institution. The interface can be viewed both in Finnish and English. Some items are only available to registered users.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Maps

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to materials produced by the students and scholars of the institution. Currently the site only provides access to dissertations and theses. Registered users, limited to institutional members, may set up an email alert to notify them of newly added materials.

repository.rName: Kagoshima Academic Repository Network (鹿児島県学術共同リポジトリ)

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the outputs of member organisations The interface is available in Japanese or English. In some cases, links are provided to other repositories. repository.rRemarks: Kagoshima Academic Repository Network (KARN) provides access to the outputs of the following organisations (As of March 2012): Kagoshima University, The International University of Kagoshima, Shigakukan University, Daiichi Institute of Technology, Kagoshima Prefectural College, The International University of Kagoshima, Junior College, Kagoshima National College of Technology.

repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository providing access to the publication output of Kagoshima University.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include university bulletins

repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The navigation for this site is well thought out and easy to use. The interface is available in English.

repository.oName: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The help section is available in English and Korean.

repository.postalAddress: London Knowledge Lab, 23-29 Emerald Street, London, WC1N 3QS
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based repository created by an EU funded 6th framework programme, collecting material relating to research on technology-supported learning. repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Japanese and English.

repository.rDescription: This is a pilot repository providing access to rotating images of objects. The interface is in Japanese.

repository.postalAddress: Reference Dept, 6425 SW Sixth Avenue, Topeka KS 66615-1099

repository.rRemarks: Partners: Kansas State Historical Society, Kansas State Library Special items include: Governmental documentation

This is a repository providing access to the theses and dissertation collections of the institution. The interface is available in Dutch and English.
Repository for theses produced in Flemish Institutes for Higher Education. The interface is available in Flemish and English.
repository.rRemarks: This repository is no longer accepting depositions, but archived thesis are still accessible.

This site is an institutional repository giving access to the research publication of the institution. The site interface is available both in German and in English and contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content. While all subjects are covered by this site currently the majority of material submitted has come from the science and technology disciplines.

This site provides access to the publication output of the institution. The interface is in English. Some items are not available as full text. Full text is available via a download link. Publications are composed of a scientific summary and an executive summary; executive summary is written in Dutch or French, and often available in English; scientific summary is in English most of the time

repository.rName: KCI (Korea Citation Index) Open Access Repository
repository.oName: NRF (National Research Foundation of Korea), Korea, Republic of
repository.rDescription: This is the repository of the Korean Citation Index which also provides open access to the full text of some articles.The interface is in Korean and English.

KDI School Digital Archives is a institutional repository for materials produced by the members of the KDI School. The main goal of the digital archives is to keep born-digital archives that documents the everyday happenings of the KDI School safe and accessible for as long as needed. It also serves as a repository of digital scholarly output of the KDI School members. Specifically, the digital archives aim to acquire KDI School digital archives and materials, and ensure it is accessible, searchable and safe from alteration. the interface is in English and Korean and contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Only the full text documents of Masters theses are available without login.

repository.oName: Centre for Social Sciences, Hungarian Academy of Sciences
repository.rDescription: The Research Documentation Centre of the Centre for Social Sciences at the Hungarian Academy of Sciences provides information on and access to research conducted at the Centre. The metadata and some of the documents of the Research Documentation Centre (RDC) are available to all visitors, but many are restricted to registered users. The interface can be set to many languages and contains RSS feeds to alert users of new content.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English.

repository.postalAddress: Keio University - Mita Campus, 2-15-45 Mita, Minato-ku, Tokyo 108-8345
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of Keio University, as well as to a number of photographs and a collection of digitised rare books by Johann Adam Kulmus. It is especially poor in supporting information and background documentation. The interface is in Japanese.

This site is an institutional repository providing access to the research output of the institution. Many items are not available as full-text. Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.rName: Kenya Human Rights Commission Institutional Repository
repository.rDescription: This is the institutional repository for the Kenya Human Rights Commission. It contains papers, reports and videos.The repository's purpose is to systematise existing KHRC resources and serve as a center of reference on human rights issues for a broad range of users. Here you will be able to find a variety of information materials related to human rights focusing mainly on civil and political rights, economic rights and social protection, equality and non-discrimination. The interface is in English and contains RSS feeds to alert users of new content.
repository.rRemarks: You may need to install specific software to view the videos

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution. Some content is not available as full-text. The interface is available in English.

repository.oName: Cyprus University of Technology (Τεχνολογικό Πανεπιστήμιο Κύπρου)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in Greek and English. Many items are not available as full text. Ktisis was named after the symbol of the Cyprus University of Technology depicting Ktisis, the spirit of creation. The symbol originates from a mosaic notation at the Efstolios house that lies in ancient Curium and originates at the start of the 5th d.c. century.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to the publication output relating to, and originating from, the Kujawsko-Pomomorski region of Poland. The site interface is available in Polish, German and English, and the repository is well supported with background information and guidance documentation. A RSS feed is available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials. You will need DjVu browser plugin to view documents.
repository.rRemarks: Project participants include: Nicolaus Copernicus University Library in Toruń, Collegium Medicum Library in Bydgoszcz, Kazimierz Wielki University Library in Bydgoszcz, as well as the remaining libraries of Scientific Libraries Consortium of Kujawsko-Pomomorski Region.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. RSS and Atom feeds can be set up to alert users of new content. The interface is in English.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Links

repository.postalAddress: Km 4 Ipetu, Omu Aran Road, PMB 1001, Omu Aran, Kwara State
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the multi-disciplinary research output of the Landmark University community. The interface is available in English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

This site is an institutional repository for materials produced by the scholars working at the University Hospital. It is notable that the vast majority of materials listed on this site are metadata (bibliographic) only, and that full-text items are a small subset of the whole. The site is well supported with guidance material for users. The interface is in English. An RSS feed is available.
This is a learning objects repository for language teaching. Some items are only available with login. The interface is in English. Rights of individual items are clearly visible.

repository.rName: LAReferencia - Red Federada de Repositorios Institucionales de Publicaciones Científicas Latinoamericanas
repository.rDescription: This is an aggregated repository which gives access to the scientific publications of eight Latin American countries: Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, El Salvador, Mexico, Peru and Venezuela by integrating material from their repositories. The interface can be set to English, German, Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, Portuguese, Japanese and Chinese.

The Latin American Open Archives Portal (LAOAP) provides access to Latin American social sciences Grey Literature. LAOAP currently contains metadata records and full text from 10 Latin American content data providers. The site interface is available in English and Spanish
This site provides access to the student output of the institution. Some items are only available to registered users. The interface is available in English.

repository.oName: Institute for Research and Innovation in Social Services
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to learning objects and resources relevant to social service practitioners, students and educators. Some items are not held on this site itself, but rather are metadata entries connecting to the relevant url.

repository.postalAddress: Centre for eScience, Lancaster University, C Floor, Bowland Tower South, Lancaster, LA1 4YT
repository.rDescription: This repository is a Social Science e-Science training and awareness resources. The repository's resources are primarily aimed at Social Scientists but many are relevant to other disciplines.
This site provides access to the research and teaching output of the institution. Many items provide links to the work held elsewhere.

The International Criminal Court puts the Legal Tools at the disposal of any person who may choose to access this web site under certain terms and conditions of use. The interface is in French, Arabic, Spanish, Chinese and English.
repository.rRemarks: The Legal Tools Project, each Legal Tool and particular components of each Legal Tool are protected by copyright, neighbouring rights, database rights and/or other applicable law. Any use of the Legal Tools other than as authorized under these Terms and Conditions is prohibited. An agreement button has to be clicked before entering the site.

repository.postalAddress: David Wilson Library, University Road, Leicester, LE1 7RH
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content,or make use of the twitter and RSS feeds.

repository.rRemarks: Special items include Maps and Translations.

repository.rName: Leodis - A photographic archive of Leeds
repository.postalAddress: Central Library, Municipal Buildings, Calverley Street, Leeds, LS1 3AB
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to a photographic archive of Leeds. Latest additions are highlighted and pictorial guided tours of Leeds are available. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation.

repository.rName: Les Livres en Ligne de Presses Universitaires de Lyon
repository.rDescription: This site makes available digitised versions of texts of interest to scholars of French social, arts and humanities work.

repository.rName: Les mémoires en ligne de l'Institut d'Etudes Politiques de Lyon
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution's students. The site's interface is available in French only. Some items are not available as full-text.

The interface is available currently in French, with plans to make English, Portuguese & Spanish versions available in due course. Around half of the material listed on the site is not available to external users and thus the size listed above reflects both openly accessible and non-openly accessible materials. Users can set up an RSS feed to notify them of newly added relevant content.

repository.rName: Letter from America by Alistair Cooke
repository.rDescription: This site contains podcasts of most of the BBC radio programme Alistair Cooke's Letter From America which currently spans from 1974 to 2014. Many more episodes will be added in the future. The interface is in English
repository.rRemarks: Letter from America contains social comment on historic events at the time that they occurred.

repository.rDescription: This is a digitised library which provides open access to books and document relating to the modern History of Greece. The interface is in English and Greek.

LASR is the home of digital repositories from Bucknell University, Carleton College, Grinnell College, St. Lawrence University, Trinity University, University of Richmond, and Whitman College. Some items require a login to view while others only have metadata. However the repository does include full text papers. The interface is in English.

This site is an institutional repository making available materials produced by the scholars at the university. Registered users can set up an email alert. An RSS feed is also available. While as of this review no theses are available on the site, because of the use of the Bepress package readers should be aware that only limited access (first 24 pages) of these documents will be Open Access.

repository.postalAddress: 8th Mile, Mysore Road, RVCE Post, Bangalore-560 059
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based repository providing access to publications in Library and Information Science from Indian Statistical Institute. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. A certain level of encryption and security is embedded in the site which may cause some users accessibility problems. Uses Manakin interface for DSpace.

This site is an institutional repository providing access to the publication output and electronic collections of the Library and Archives Canada. Canada’s documentary heritage is made available here in numerous digital collections, virtual exhibitions, and archived materials. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation. The interface and contents is available in both English and French.
repository.rRemarks: Special Items: Digitised historical documents.

repository.rName: Library and Historical Collections Digital Resources
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the collections of the institution, including student thesis. Some collections are only available to members of the institution. The interface is available in English. Some content is not available full-text.

repository.rRemarks: This system is running eprints server software (EPrints 3.3.10) developed at the University of Southampton. For more information see http://www.eprints.org/

repository.postalAddress: PO Box 84, Lincoln University, Lincoln 7647, Canterbury

repository.rDescription: University repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Interface in English.

Copyright and technical information is displayed on the website. The interface is in English.

This is an institutional repository providing access to the scholarly output of the Max Planck institutes. A considerable portion of material on this site is bibliographic in nature, and does not accompany the full-text in an Openly Accessible format. However, the size figure listed here reflects the quantity of full-text Open Access material actually available. As material is reviewed by eDoc managers before being made publicly visible, some portion of the Open Access documents are restricted to local access only for a time. The site interface is available in English or German and is well supported with background documentation and guidance materials in both languages.
repository.rRemarks: It appears that this repository is in the process of being updated and transferred to a replacement site. Items are sill accessible.

repository.postalAddress: Polaris House, North Star Avenue, Swindon, SN2 1EU
repository.rDescription: This archive is an Institutional Repository for NERC Staff. It contains metadata and full text (where possible) for published papers, reports, maps and other outputs from four of the NERC Research Centres: the British Antarctic Survey, British Geological Survey, the Centre for Ecology & Hydrology and the National Oceanographic Centre. It is also accessible to Staff at NERC's Swindon Office. A RSS feed is available. NORA provides information on research outcomes for NERC's intramural research to the RCUK Gateway to Research system. Subject specialities are atmospheric science, earth science, earth observation, environmental maths and statistics, marine, polar, science based archaeology, technology and e-science, terrestrial and freshwater science. Not all items are available in full-text on this site, however they are linked to subscription based external sites. RSS and Atom feeds are available.

repository.rRemarks:
The Network was formed in partnership with a number of Caribbean institutions conducting scientific research and generating information.
This project comes as a direct outcome of the Caribbean Academy of Sciences, Jamaica hosting several workshops in collaboration with Inter Academy Panel, IAP, the US National Science Foundation and the Academy of Sciences for the Developing World, TWAS as part of their project on "Open Access to Scientific Literature and other Digital Scientific Information Resources in Central America and the Caribbean".
The project was carried out with the support of the UNESCO Kingston Office for the Caribbean and is a contribution to the UNESCO commitment to improve and promote Open Access to research information and add value to its Global Open Access Portal, GOAP

National editors from 25 countries act as editors for entries from these countries, whilst International Centre for Research in Organic Food Systems (ICROFS) handles the rest of the entries. The interface is available in both English and German.

This is an institutional repository or academic archive providing access to publications from Södertörn University (Publikationer från Södertörns högskola). While much of the material is available in full-text some items are bibliographic records only. As such the size value shown here reflects those items that are Open Access in full-text. The site interface is available in English or Swedish.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The site interface is available in Swedish, Norwegian and English. Some items are not available as full-text.

This is an institutional repository or academic archive providing access to publications from Stockholm University (Publikationer från Stockholms universitet). While much of the material is available in full-text some items are bibliographic records only. As such the size value shown here reflects those items that are Open Access in full-text. The site interface is available in English or Swedish.

This is an institutional repository providing access to publications from Umeå University. While much of the material is available in full-text some items are bibliographic records only. As such the size value shown here reflects those items that are Open Access in full-text. The site interface is available in English or Swedish.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: DIVA

repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository or academic archive providing access to publications from publications from Uppsala University (Publikationer från Uppsala universitet). While much of the material is available in full-text some items are bibliographic records only. As such the size value shown here reflects those items that are Open Access in full-text. The site interface is available in Swedish or English.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. A few publications are not available in full-text, and these are clearly marked within the site's display. The site interface is available in English or Swedish, and the supporting documentation is available in both languages. Users may set up an RSS feed to be alerted to new content.

repository.rName: Publikations- und Dokumentenserver der Universitätsbibliothek Marburg
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The site includes theses from 1997 onwards, and other materials from 2003. The interface is in German.

repository.rName: Publikations- und Dokumentenserver der Universitätsbibliothek Siegen
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The site also contains electronic magazines and some content is only accessible to university users. A filtering function displays freely available material as well as licensed content. An RSS feed is available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials. The site interface is available in German and English.

University repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Not all items listed are available as full text, and many are bibliographic entries only. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in German.

This site is a university repository originally providing access to the student theses produced at the RWTH Aachen University and a few ebooks were also included. In November 2006 the repository has expanded its collection remit to include all forms of scholarly work produced at the institution. The abstract of each document is available in both English and German. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation.

This growing institutional repository is an open access archive for ePrints of research papers, proceedings and reports as well as dissertations and excellent students' theses. It also contains electronic versions of single publications and institution series of the integrated Potsdam University Press. The site includes a list of most recently deposited papers, along with an RSS feed allowing people to keep up to date with new additions.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Kooperativer Bibliotheksverbund Berlin-Brandenburg (KOBV)

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is in German.

repository.rName: Publishing Network for Geoscientific and Environmental Data
repository.oName: Alfred Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research
repository.postalAddress: Alfred Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research, Postfach 12 01 61, 27515 Bremerhaven
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to datasets relating to science, with special emphasis on environmental, marine and geological basic research. The site also makes the publication output of PANGAEA available. Some items are not available via Open Access and are only available to registered members of the project in question. The datasets can be searched by topic, project, or institution. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation. Some data sets are password protected for an embargo period. The interface is in English.
repository.rRemarks: Operated by the 'Alfred Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research' and the 'Center for Marine Environmental Sciences.' Financed by 'The European Commission,' 'Research Federal Ministry of Education and Research,' and 'Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft.'

repository.rDescription: A subject based repository of life sciences journal literature as well as materials deposited by individual authors. This is an extensive and expansive resource for researchers in the bioscience, biotech and biomedical related disciplines. The citations database PubMed links to full-text materials within PMC. Thanks to a NLM digitisation activity older journal content is being made freely available, back to the early 1900s in some cases. Currently 250 journal titles are included within the site. It is possible to register for an update email to ensure notification when new journals are added to the PMC collections. The size value given is the number of author submitted manuscripts.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), National Library of Medicine (NLM)

repository.uName: Canada Institute for Scientific and Technical Information
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based repository, that mirrors the data held on the PubMed Central site. Some material is currently unavailable on this mirror site due to publisher restrictions, although bibliographic entries and links to the parent site are given. A range of supporting guidance and background information are available on this site. The interface is available in French and English.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: National Research Council’s Canada Institute for Scientific and Technical Information (NRC-CISTI), the Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR), and the US National Library of Medicine (NLM).

repository.postalAddress: 504 West State Street, West Lafayette, IN 47907-2058
repository.rDescription: University repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Includes a paper of the day highlighted. Registered users, not limited to institutional members, can set up email alerts or an RSS feed to notify them of newly added relevant content. Currently only links to theses in Digital Dissertations and a limited quantity of material submitted by the library services have been included in the collections. Theses & dissertations are only freely accessible for the first 24 pages to external users. However, beyond the first 24 pages theses are not openly accessible to non-institutional members. Subscribers to Digital Dissertations will be able to read the full-text.

repository.uName: Purdue University Libraries, Archives and Special Collections
repository.postalAddress: 504 West State Street, West Lafayette, IN 47907-2058
repository.rDescription: This site is a repository providing electronic access to the Purdue University Libraries, Archives and Special Collections cultural documents. Includes the George Palmer Putnam collection of Amelia Earhart photographs and personal papers and Frank B. and Lillian M Gilbreth Library of Management Videos.
This institutional repository contains the intellectual output of Pwani University. The interface is in English and includes RSS feeds.

repository.uName: School of Politics, International Studies and Philosophy
repository.rDescription: This subject repository site contains two disparate but related collections of lengthy papers produced by members of the School and external researchers. These are managed as essentially open access published journals. One site deals with many aspects of Europeanisation, whilst ConWEB focuses on constitutionalism. All material is from 2000 to present and is peer-reviewed by the editorial team members.

repository.rDescription: Electoral Data Repository is an official database of elections in Brazil. The interface is in Portuguese.
repository.rRemarks:
The electoral data repository is a compilation of raw data of the elections since 1945 facing researchers, media and the general public who are interested in analyzing the data of voters, candidates, results and accountability of elections.
All files are provided in "txt" format and can be imported into any statistical software, database or spreadsheet. Any query, filter or crossover is the responsibility of the researcher.
It is important to read the instruction file that comes with tables and pay attention to the date of generation of the file in order to make imports and queries appropriately.

This is the institutional repository of Napier University in Edinburgh. At present it contains metadata for the c800 items submitted to the RAE in 2008, together with the full-text of about twenty theses and journal articles. A university-wide mandate to deposit has been approved by the Academic Board for it is intended that this will, in time, hold the complete intellectual output of university academic staff and research students. Author, Department, Subject and Year of Publication searches are provided, together with field controlled search facilities.

repository.rDescription: Repository for the scholarly output of researchers administered by the University of Pennsylvania Library. Materials are chosen by participating units (departments, schools, centres, institutes, etc.). Theses & dissertations are only freely accessible for the first 24 pages to external users. However, beyond the first 24 pages theses are not openly accessible to non-institutional members. Subscribers to Digital Dissertations will be able to read the full-text. Registered users, not solely limited to depositing community, can set up RSS feeds and email alerting when relevant new content is added.

repository.oName: Harold B. Lee Library at Brigham Young University
repository.rDescription: ScholarsArchive is Brigham Young University’s institutional repository for the scholarly and creative content produced by the University. ScholarsArchive makes research, publications, and data produced by BYU faculty and students available worldwide.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. As well as theses & dissertations the two major collections of materials on this site are divided into those concerned with natural resources and all other subjects researched at the institute. A large amount of the material is of historical interest, covering as it does over 100 years of issues in natural history, forestry and the environment in the region. A certain level of encryption and security is embedded in the site which may cause some users accessibility problems. RSS feeds are available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials. The interface is in English.

The mandate of the Scholarship at UWindsor repository is to enable researchers in our campus community to preserve and provide open access to a wide range of scholarly and creative works. This could include copies of published articles where permitted, conference papers, presentations, theses, videos of talks, musical scores, images and more.
Since Scholarship at UWindsor is an open access repository, its contents will be freely available to anyone with access to the internet. This enables the work of scholars from the University of Windsor to reach the broadest possible audience and helps to make publicly funded research more publicly accessible.The interface is in English and it includes and RSS to alert users of new content.

repository.postalAddress: 8902 La Jolla Shores Dr, La Jolla, CA, San Diego County
repository.rDescription: This repository contains information from over 800 expeditions by the Scripps Institution of Oceanography since 1903. Two interfaces are available for the user (advanced and basic) allowing the use of a graphical or text based search tool as desired. In addition two meta data and one grid viewer tools are available. While the oceanographic information proffered does cover the world's oceans, particular attention has been applied to the Pacific and adjacent regions. The image collection is rich not only in recent materials, but illustrations and drawings from such primary source materials as expedition logbooks. The site is part of the overall National Science Digital Library (NSDL).
repository.rRemarks: Partners: National Science Digital Library (NSDL), San Diego Supercomputer Center (SDSC), NSF Program, ITR Program

The South Carolina State Documents Depository provides access to publications produced by state agencies and state-supported academic institutions. These publications provide citizens with crucial information about state government, including statistics, annual accountability reports, and data on a wide variety of topics related to the state. Items in the State Documents Depository include both print publications and “born digital” documents often originally published on agency websites. the interface is in English.

repository.rDescription: Online Doctoral Thesis Server (TDX) is a digital collection of doctoral theses presented at some Spanish universities. The participating universities are: Universitat de Barcelona, Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya, Universitat Pompeu Fabra, Universitat de Girona, Universitat de Lleida, Universitat Rovira i Virgili, Universitat Oberta de Catalunya, Universitat Ramon Llull, Universitat de les Illes Balears, Universitat de València, Universitat Jaume I, Universidad de Cantabria, Universidad de Murcia. TDX allows for remote consultation of the complete text of theses over the Internet, additionally allowing the user to construct searches by author, title, knowledge area, university of publication, etc.
repository.rRemarks:
This repository uses OAI Base URLs in a non-standard way - providing separate OAI Base URLs for each participating institution, rather than a single OAI Base URL with OAI sets for each institution. repository.rRemarks: Many of the student thesis cannot be downloaded

repository.rName: The Five Colleges of Ohio Digital Repository: Looking Back, Looking Forward
repository.rDescription: Looking Back, Looking Forward is a project that documents the founding of the Women's Studies program at Denison University. This digital collection contains materials from both Women's Studies departmental files and from the University Archives. The interface is in English and it contains an RSS feed to alert users to new content.

repository.rName: The IT University of Copenhagen's Repository
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the IT University of Copenhagen. The interface is in English.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English. Some content is not available as full-text.

This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Spanish, Catalan languages and English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Some items are not available as full text.
This site provides access to educational resources. Users must click on a log in as guest link to access site. Several items are held on separate sites.

The Parthenon Frieze Repository repository is an organized infrastructure of digital content, that offers free access to cultural material. The repository was carried out by the National Documentation Centre (EKT) and the YSMA-Acropolis Restoration Service of the Hellenic Ministry of Culture and Tourism. The repository provides the possibility of immediate access to images of the frieze as a database for scholars.

ROS is Heriot-Watt University's institutional repository which allows open access to the work of staff and students of the University.
Until recently ROS contained only Heriot-Watt theses but it is expanding to include other types of output, such as working papers, articles and conference papers.

repository.rName: The Romanovs and the Perm region
repository.oName: The Perm State Regional Universal Library named after A.M.Gorky
repository.rDescription: This is an electronic archive that has been created to celebrate the 400th anniversary of the Romanov dynasty. The interface is in Russian and contains RSS feeds.
This is the institutional repository of Seoul Institute. The interface is in Korean and contains RSS feeds to alert users of new content.

repository.rName: The Texas Tech University School of Law Digital Repository
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research and archives of th institution. The interface is available in English. Some times are only available to registered users.

repository.postalAddress: Jl. Lodan Raya No. 2, Ancol - Jakarta Utara
repository.rDescription: This is the institutional repository of Bunda Mulia University, which allows open access to the work of staff and students. The interface is in English and Indonesian and includes RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Many items are not available as the full text.

repository.uName: The University of Edinburgh Centre for Research Collections
repository.postalAddress: Old College, South Bridge, Edinburgh, EH8 9YL
repository.rDescription: This on-line archive contains images and detailed meta-data of many of the historic collections of Edinburgh University, including their art collection, musical instruments and calenders. The interface is in English.

repository.oName: Central Library of the West Pomeranian Province

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The site interface is available mostly in English, although virtually the entire contents are in French.
This site provides access to the student theses output of the institution after 2003. The interface is available in Danish or English.

This is an institutional repository provides access to the research output of the institution since 1995. Some items are not available via Open Access and are only available to registered members of this institution. The site is available in English or Dutch.
repository.rRemarks: At the beginning of May 2009, the Repository included more than 49,000 titles; some 9,600 publications were full text and freely available.

This repository was put out of action by the earthquake of the 11th March 2011. We hope that it will eventually be restored.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include library rare collection of postcards,

The site interface is available in Japanese and English, although the Help section is only available in Japanese. #es

Toulouse 1 Capitole Publications is the Institutional Repository of Toulouse 1 University. It has open access to some of the work of the University, but other articles are not available as full text items. It includes articles, books, book chapters, conference and working papers, preprints, these and case notes. the interface is in French and English and has an RSS feed.
repository.rRemarks: This system is running eprints server software (EPrints 3.2.3 (Battenburg) [Born on 2010-07-01]) developed at the University of Southampton. For more information see http://www.eprints.org/

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in French and English.

repository.rName: Trakya University Academic Open Access System
repository.rDescription: This is the institutional repository of Trakya University which provides open access to the work of staff and students. The interface is in Turkish, English and German and includes RSS feeds to alert users of new content.

repository.rName: Traveling Culture: Circuit Chautauqua in the Twentieth Century
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to the publication output of 7,949 publicity brochures, promotional advertisements and talent circulars for some 4,546 performers who were part of the Chautauqua circuit. These talent brochures are drawn from the Records of the Redpath Lyceum Bureau, held by the University of Iowa Libraries. Users can browse by subject or name.

This site provides access to regulatory texts relating to libraries in Spain. The interface is available in Spanish, English, Basque, Catalan, Valencian and Galician. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
This repository provides access to the collections of the institution, primarily of images.

repository.postalAddress: Mariam Coffin Canaday Library, Bryn Mawr College, 101 North Merion Avenue, Bryn Mawr, Pennsylva
repository.rDescription: This site is a collective repository that draws from material of three college libraries. The site aims to illustrate the textual and graphic images of the past and help shape the ideas and ideals of coming generations. Users can browse/search a total of 19 collections.

repository.oName: Haverford College, Bryn Mawr College, Swarthmore College
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the students. Theses listed are primarily those submitted for undergraduate degrees. Due to the Colleges particular interests these materials are much richer in arts, humanities and social science publications than the sciences. Many items are not available without logging in it appears that only images and speeches are openly accessible.

repository.postalAddress: One Trinity Place, San Antonio, Texas 78212-7200
repository.rDescription: This is a university repository that makes available a small portion of two collections of images: the Historical Images Archive and the Theatre Arts Images Archive. Both provide digitised versions of items from the institutional archives. The former includes materials back to the dawn of the 20th Century, while the latter includes images of contemporary drama productions.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of Trinity College, Dublin. Some items are not available via Open Access and are only available as metadata (bibliographic record) entries if publisher copyright restrictions apply. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation.
This site provides access to the output of the institution. The interface is in English. Some items are not available as full-text.

This is a subject based institutional repository from the Graduate School on Trustworthy Software Systems making available materials from the School. The main interest of the School is in safety critical software engineering methods. Materials for the years 2005-2006 are currently available. The site interface is in English. Users may set up RSS/ Atoms feeds to be alerted to new content.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. This site interface is in Japanese and English. Some items are not available via Open Access and are only available as metadata (bibliographic record) entries.

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to digitised historical source material from the ULB Darmstadt (Universitäts- und Landesbibliothek), some dating back to the 1500's. Materials include original magazines, incunabula, reports, illustrations, plans, photos, dictionaries and encyclopaedias. Also material that is interesting for the history of the region, e.g. the early yellow pages of the city of Darmstadt, Hessia.

repository.uName: Library of the University of Amsterdam
repository.rDescription: University repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. While this is one repository it comprises three interface sections: the principal UvA-DARE site for all materials, and the subsections UvA Dissertations Online and UvA Scripties Online for those interested in student publications (doctoral & masters respectively). The whole site is available in English or Dutch and includes a document of the day highlighted. While there is a range of full text material openly accessible, a lot of the data on this site are bibliographical listings of all publications by institutional authors; much of which is not freely readable. Whilst this provides a showcase for the institution it diminishes the functionality for anyone expecting to be able to read all the material online significantly. The student based materials are however accessible in full-text. The site is well supported by a wealth of supporting documentation and background information. As well as the normal browse and search options there is a well implemented author showcase function.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Innovations in Scientific Information Supply, Digital Academic Repositories programme, SURF, ICTO Matching Fund, EDUBA Special items include: Biographical

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English. Some content is not available as full-text.

repository.rName: University of Adelaide Library Electronic Text Collection
repository.rDescription: This site is a repository created by an institution of public domain monographic (book) works. Each item is considered a separate edition to a physical text, due to the process of digitisation. As such pagination and layout of these works will be different to any physical copies. Most items are openly accessible to all, however a limited number of items are restricted to members of the University of Adelaide only and are only available as metadata (bibliographic record) entries for the rest of the world. A MARC format index file of all titles is also available for access.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to research at Aalborg University from the year 1992 and onwards. The interface is in Danish or English. Some items may not be available as full text.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in German and English. Users may set up an RSS feed to be alerted to new content.

repository.oName: Deutschen Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt
repository.rDescription: This is a small organisational repository with transport data and models made freely available; currently only dealing with automotive transportation. The site interface is English or German.
This site provides access to the research outputs of the institution. The interface is available in English and Lithuanian. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.rName: Via Sapientiae: The Institutional Repository at DePaul Universit
repository.rDescription: Via Sapientiae is the institutional repository of DePaul University which collects, organises, and provides open access to scholarly works produced by the University's faculty, staff, centres and institutes, and students. Via Sapientiae also showcases DePaul's unique Vincentian heritage materials. The interface is in English.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. This site provides Atom and RSS feeds for user to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.
This site provides access to the research and teaching output of the institution. The interface is available in a mixture of English and Marathi.

repository.oName: The Honor Society of Nursing, Sigma Theta Tau International
repository.rDescription: This is a repository which contains nursing related research and evidence-based practice materials on a worldwide level. It is hosted by the Honor Society of Nursing, Sigma Theta Tau International (STTI) which is head-quartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, USA. the interface is in English.
repository.rRemarks: Many records are still abstract only, but there are many presentations available and the written reports are peer reviewed prior to deposit.

repository.oName: Fundatorem Fundacji Kultury i Dziedzictwa Ormian Polskich (Foundation of Culture And Heritage of Polish Armenians)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the digital version of the Archives of Polish Armenians. The interface is available in Polish.

Virtual Commons is Bridgewater State University’s open-access repository for the scholarly works, research, publications, creative activity, and reports produced by the faculty, students, and staff of Bridgewater State University and its collaborative partners. The interface is in English and includes an RSS feed to alert users to new content.
This is a subject based repository focusing on the history of the Jamestown colony, Virginia.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: newspapers, maps, court records, labor contracts and letters.

repository.rDescription: This is the virtual library of Corporacion de Estudios para Latinoamerica (CIEPLAN). It allows access to the books and papers from CIEPLAN, ranging from academic articles about politics to technical research about Public Policies, Economy and Development. The interface is in Spanish and includes an RSS feed to alert users of new content.
This site provides access to the publication of the organisation and its' partners. The interface is available in English.
repository.rRemarks: Other online reference sources accessible via this resource include several databases, gateways, portals, e-journals, e-books and e-news.

repository.rName: Virtual Reading Room of The John Paul II Catholic University of Lublin
repository.oName: Katolicki Uniwersytet Lubelski Jana Pawła II (John Paul II Catholic University of Lublin)
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Some content is not available as full-text. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in Polish and English. This site uses a mixture of Adobe Reader and DjVu to display content.
repository.rRemarks: This site also provides access to special collections library old books, manuscripts, artwork and cartography.

repository.rDescription: This Institutional repository contains the work, research, scholarly and enterprise output of University of West London staff and research students. Many items are not openly accessible but there are currently some full text items. The interface is available in English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
This site provides access to images of various collections of visual arts. Further details about the collections are available and may link to external sites for further information.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.
This site is an e-print archive set up as an alternative to the popular arXiv.org service.

repository.oName: Centre de Données astronomiques de Strasbourg
repository.rDescription: This site is an aggregating repository providing access to datasets gathered and published by the CDS relating to the study of astronomy. Access is available via VizieR itself or through servers closer to the users location. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation.
repository.rRemarks: Partners:CDS (Centre de Données astronomiques de Strasbourg) and ESA-ESRIN (Information Systems Division).

repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The site interface is in German only. The full text of only a very small number of items are available as open access.

A subject repository of psychological related literature hosted by Saarländische Universitäts (Saarland University). Well supported with background information and documents. The user interface is in German.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Deutschen Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG)

repository.rName: Volltextserver Universität Ulm - VTS Publication Service
repository.rDescription: This is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution.

repository.oName: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English.
This site provides access to the output of the institution. Many items are only available to registered users. The interface is in English.

repository.oName: VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland
repository.rDescription: This is a organisational repository for openly accessible publications produced by VTT, a high technology contract research organisation. The site lists over 50,000 items, however the size value given here refers to those that are available in full-text only. The site interface is in English or Finnish.
This site provides access to the student output of the institution. The interface is available in English.
repository.rRemarks: This is a projects aided by the NRF (National Research Foundation).

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Lithuanian or English.

Wageningen Yield is a collection of staff publications, dissertations, theses, presentations and monographs containing output from Wageningen University & Research Centre. Some documents are subject to copyright restrictions.Open Access documents are clearly marked. The interface is in English, Dutch, German and French.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Web links

repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository of Walisongo State Institute for Islamic Studies, one of Islamic State University in Indonesia.The interface is in English and it contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
Repository provides access to the research output of Warsaw University of Technology. Not all items are openly accessible. The interface is in English.
This site provides access to digital scans of revolutionary and empire period drama and plays. The interface is in English.
repository.rRemarks: Special items: scripts

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up Atom or RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.

repository.rName: Washington Research Library Consortium Special Collections
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the digitised collections of the consortium. The Interface is available in English.

This is an academic repository for Waterford Institute of Technology, a third level college in the South of Ireland. Recent additions can be tracked in Atom or RSS. Not all items are available as open access materials, and can only be viewed by registered users.

This site is an institutional repository providing access to the publication output of the Dutch National Institute for Public Health and the Environment (RIVM). Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation. #es

This repository provides access to sheet music. The interface can be viewed in several languages. Sheet Music can be downloaded for specific instruments.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution. The interface is in English.

repository.rDescription: An institutional repository for the University of Westminster, containing research produced from 2001 onwards. Currently only some items have openly available full-text, the majority of these being journal articles or conference papers and PhD theses.

repository.rDescription: This is a repository providing access to the student output of the White Rose Consortium, which comprises of of three UK Universities (York, Sheffield & Leeds). Users may set up RSS and Atom feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.oName: White Rose Consortium: University of Leeds; The University of Sheffield; University of York

repository.rRemarks: Partners: JISC, CURL, SHERPA

repository.rName: WHO Institutional Repository for Information Sharing
repository.rDescription: This repository provides free access to the World Health Organization's publications,technical materials and more. Its interface and contents are available in Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish. Users may set up RSS feeds receive alerts of new content.

This is a regional repository providing access to the digital collections of the Libraries of Wielkopolska. Some items may need DjVu to view. Registered users can set up an RSS feed to notify them of newly added relevant content. Interface can be viewed in Polish or English.

repository.postalAddress: 149 New Montgomery Street, Floor 6, San Francisco, CA 94105
repository.rDescription: This is a media file repository which gives access to public domain, freely licensed educational media content to anyone in their own language. It contains images, sounds and video clips. The interface is available in a large selection of languages and anyone can contribute new items.

repository.rName: William & Mary Law School Scholarship Repository
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.oName: Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars
repository.postalAddress: Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center, One Woodrow Wilson Plaza, 1300 Pennsylvania Ave, NW Washington DC 200
repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to archival documents pertaining to the Cold War. Well supported with background information and documentation about the project.The interface is in English.
repository.rRemarks: Special Items: Primary source documents pertaining to the Cold War, including correspondence and official reports.

repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Extensive information on the advisory and editorial boards that support this site's content and strategic development are included.
This site provides access to the research output of the staff and students of the institution. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in English.
This site provides access to open access leanring materials relating to wireless technology (under Materials). The interface is available in English. Content is available in various languages.

This is a subject based institutional repository providing access to technical reports from the Departments of Computer Science & Applied Mathematics, and Mathematics. Currently there are only materials relating to applied mathematics and computing, rather than pure mathematics in the repository. The site interface is in English.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The interface is in English.
This is an openly accessible collection of academic work produced by Frede G Moreno, an academic at Western Mindanoa State University.

In the Wolfenbütteler Digitalen Bibliothek the HAB publishes digital editions of rare books from its collections or editions prepared in cooperative projects or editions that are entrusted to the library for long-term archiving. The interface is in German and English and contains an RSS feed that alerts users to new content.
repository.rRemarks: Many screens need to be navigated to get to the digitised books. Some entries are still under development.

repository.postalAddress: MX Building (MX307), City Campus North, Camp Street, Wolverhampton, WV1 1AD
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Currently materials have been largely deposited by the Centre of Excellence in Learning & Teaching, and the School of Computing. Where possible through licensing rights/copyright agreements, the full text of these items will be made available on an open access basis.

repository.oName: Marine Biological Laboratory & Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution
repository.postalAddress: Information Office, 266 Woods Hole Road, Woods Hole, MA 02543-1050
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based institutional repository making material available from the Marine Biological Laboratory (MBL) and the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI) at Woods Hole. The site is especially rich in conference proceedings (International Association of Aquatic and Marine Science Libraries and Information Centers, IAMSLIC), theses, and technical reports. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.

repository.oName: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to primary material from around the globe. Some items are not available to download. The interface is available in Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Portuguese, Russian, and Spanish. Various partner institutions have been involved.
repository.rRemarks: Special Items include Manuscripts, Sound Recordings and Maps

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Some items are restricted to WorldFish staff only. Some items are not available as full text. The interface is in English.

repository.oName: Wyższa Szkoła Biznesu - National-Louis University z siedzibą w Nowym Sączu
repository.rDescription: This institutional repository allows open access to the work of staff and students of the School of Business at National Loius- University (WSB-NLU) in Nowy Sącz/Poland. The Interface is in Polish and English and it has several RSS feeds

repository.postalAddress: WSU Libraries, Washington State University, Pullman, WA, 99164-5610
repository.rDescription: This site is a university library repository providing access to resources held in digital collections of Washington State University Library. This is an institutional repository providing access to the research output of the repository. The interface is in Chinese and English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.postalAddress: Universitaire Campus, Gebouw H, BE 3590, Diepenbeek
repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution's students. The site contents reflect the particular interests of the institution being primarily concerned with the industrial or applied sciences, and sociology along with social policy. The site interface is in Dutch, or partial English.

repository.uName: Harvey Cushing/John Hay Whitney Medical Library
repository.rDescription: A collection of medically related graduate student dissertations. Well supported with background information on the advantages conferred from open access of thesis information.

repository.rRemarks: This is a new repository and currently contains very few items

repository.rName: Yamaguchi University Navigator for Open access Collection and Archives

This is the institutional repository of the Higher Education Council.

repository.rName: Yonsei University Medical Library Open Access Repository
repository.rDescription: This is the institutional repository of Yonsei University Medical Library which provides access to the work of staff and students. The interface is in English and Korean and contains RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
repository.rRemarks: The full text of theses are stored in the repository, but the access to published articles is through a link to the publishers' page. Access to the full text therefore depends on the journal subscriptions of the user or their institution.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the multimedia collections of the institution. The interface is available in English.

repository.rName: York St John University Institutional Repository
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution and special collections. The interface is in English.

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository containing materials produced by the scholars at this university. Some items are only available to locally registered users of the site. An email alerting service is available for locally registered users.

repository.rRemarks: Not all of the institutions have contributed material at time of viewing.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Interface available in Chinese and Chinese (simplified) and English. A few items are not available as full-text.

This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. Interface available in Chinese and Chinese (simplified) and English. A few items are not available as full-text.

repository.postalAddress: Avenida San Pablo 180, Reynosa Tamaulipas,, Azcapotzalco, Mexico, Distrito Fed
repository.rDescription: This is the institutional repository of UAM Atzcapotzalco which allows open access to the work of staff and researchers. The interface is in Spanish and it has RSS feeds to alert users of new content.

repository.oName: Organisation Européenne pour la Recherche Nucléaire

repository.rRemarks: Users may experience connection difficulties with this site.

repository.rName: Zielonogórska Biblioteka Cyfrowa (Digital Library of Zielona Gora)
repository.rDescription: This is a university repository providing access to the publication output of University of Zielona Gora and the surrounding region. Of particular note is that documents on this site are in the DjVu format, and as such require the download of a LizardTech based DjVu browser to view. It is possible to download publications in a ZIP file format.

repository.postalAddress: 7th Floor, Stanley House, Cnr 1ST Street/Jason Moyo Avenue, Harare
repository.rDescription:
The Zimbabwe Open University Repository is an online locus for collecting, preserving, and disseminating the intellectual output of ZOU. The Repository contains research journal articles, conference presentations, and digital versions of theses and dissertations.
The ZOU Repository contains material from four faculties namely, the Faculty of Arts and Education, Faculty of Commerce and Law, Faculty of Science and Technology and the Faculty of Applied Social Sciences. The interface is in English, French or Spanish and includes RSS feeds to alert users to new content.
repository.rRemarks: This is a new repository and will hold more items in the future.

repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the University of Zurich. Registered users can set up email alerts and all users can set up RSS feeds, to notify them of newly added relevant content. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation.
repository.rRemarks: Formerly hosted by Open Repository.

repository.rDescription: This sit is an open electronic archive of full-text scientific works of scientists of several universities and research institutions in Кыргызстан (Kyrgyzstan).
